perturbation.original_text:
The Issuer shall and does hereby indemnify and save the Indemnified Parties harmless from and against any liability, claim, demand or loss, excluding loss of profits, which the Indemnified Parties may suffer, whether pursuant to statute or otherwise, howsoever arising, in consequence of:

                  (a)      any  statement  or  omission  in the  Prospectus,  or                            otherwise made or omitted by the Issuer in connection                            with the  Offering,  being or being  alleged  to be a                            misrepresentation;

                  (b)      the  Issuer not  complying  with any  requirement  of                            applicable   legislation  of  Canada  or  of  British                            Columbia or Alberta; or

                  (c)      any  order  made  or any  inquiry,  investigation  or                            proceeding commenced,  threatened or announced by any                            securities  regulatory  authority or other  competent                            authority  in  British  Columbia,  Alberta or Ontario                            which prevents or restricts trading in or the sale or                            distribution  in British  Columbia and Alberta of the                            Securities.
perturbation.changed_text:
The Issuer shall indemnify and save the Indemnified Parties harmless from and against any liability, claim, demand or loss, excluding loss of profits, which the Indemnified Parties may suffer in consequence of:

                  (a)      any  statement  or  omission  in the  Prospectus,  or                            otherwise made or omitted by the Issuer in connection                            with the  Offering,  being or being  alleged  to be a                            misrepresentation;

                  (b)      the  Issuer not  complying  with any  requirement  of                            applicable   legislation  of  Canada  or  of  British                            Columbia or Alberta; or

                  (c)      any  order  made  or any  inquiry,  investigation  or                            proceeding commenced,  threatened or announced by any                            securities  regulatory  authority or other  competent                            authority  in  British  Columbia,  Alberta or Ontario                            which prevents or restricts trading in or the sale or                            distribution  in British  Columbia and Alberta of the                            Securities.
perturbation.explanation: By removing "whether pursuant to statute or otherwise, howsoever arising," the indemnification clause is weakened. This could be interpreted as limiting the issuer's indemnification obligations, potentially violating securities laws in British Columbia, which may require broader indemnification to protect sponsors from liabilities arising from prospectus misstatements or omissions, regardless of the specific legal basis.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Act (British Columbia) - related to prospectus liability and due diligence requirements for sponsors.

perturbation.original_text: If any claim contemplated by this section is asserted against any of the Indemnified Parties, the Issuer shall be entitled (but not required) to assume the defence on behalf of the Indemnified Parties of any suit brought to enforce such claim, provided that the defence shall be through legal counsel acceptable to the Indemnified Parties and no admission of liability shall be made by the Issuer or the Indemnified Parties without, in each case, the prior written consent of all the parties hereto, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld. Any of the Indemnified Parties shall have the right to employ separate counsel in any such suit and participate in the defence thereof, at the expense of the Issuer.
perturbation.changed_text: If any claim contemplated by this section is asserted against any of the Indemnified Parties, the Issuer shall be entitled to assume the defence on behalf of the Indemnified Parties of any suit brought to enforce such claim, provided that the defence shall be through legal counsel. Any of the Indemnified Parties shall have the right to employ separate counsel in any such suit and participate in the defence thereof.
perturbation.explanation: Removing "(but not required)", "acceptable to the Indemnified Parties", and "and no admission of liability shall be made by the Issuer or the Indemnified Parties without, in each case, the prior written consent of all the parties hereto, such consent not to be unreasonably withheld" significantly alters the control the Indemnified Parties (Sponsor) have over their defense. Specifically, the Sponsor no longer has approval over counsel and any consent needed for liability admission. Removing 'at the expense of the Issuer' also removes financial protection for the indemnified parties.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles of indemnity and potentially the duty of good faith in contractual performance, as applicable in British Columbia.

perturbation.explanation: By removing "reasonable" before "fees and out-of-pocket expenses", "(which fees, not including expenses and taxes, are not expected to exceed $15,000 but may after consultation with and receipt of the prior approval of the Issuer)", and "if any (including reasonable counsel fees and expenses)", the protection offered to the issuer is removed and exposes them to uncapped and potentially unreasonable fees, impacting financial liability and fairness. This is because 'reasonable' gives the party paying the fees the explicit right to ensure costs are not excessive.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles related to good faith and fair dealing, and potentially regulations related to the reasonableness of expenses charged in connection with securities offerings in British Columbia.
